'Twas night; and sleep had o'er my eyelids shed</br>His lulling poppies and oblivious dews;</br>Methought, by two Elysian Genii led</br>O'er dreary wilds, I met the welcome Muse.</br>An emerald wand she wav'd, and all around</br>A blooming landscape rose, supremely fair;</br>Imbowering trees, with golden fruitage crown'd,</br>Luxuriant flowers, whose sweets imbalm the air:</br>Birds, jasper fountains, grottoes, crystal hills,</br>Bath'd with the murmuring fall of silver-sparkling rills.

Charm'd with the beauties of the fairy scene,</br>I now was entering a perfum'd alcove,</br>Where myrtles tall their blossom'd arches green</br>With blushing braids of eglantine inwove:</br>When lo!  descending from an orient cloud,</br>A gliding Form advanc'd with gait sublime;</br>While voices sweet and choral harpings loud</br>My fancy sooth'd with their melodious chime.</br>O'er her majestic lineaments serene</br>Heaven breath'd its softest smiles, and shone in all her mien!

More spotless far her forehead's dazzling white</br>Than new-blown jassamine or falling snows;</br>While o'er her cheek flush'd Beauty's blooming light</br>In rich expansion ravishingly flows.</br>Sweet the blue mildness of her winning eyes,</br>More gentle than the meekness of the dove</br>Which fearless in her downy bosom lies;</br>Her charming aspect beams transcendent love.</br>With purple amarant and lilies wreath'd,</br>Her length of auburn hair celestial fragrance breath'd.

The zephyr on the trembling violet's breast,</br>As she approach'd, in softer cadence sigh'd;</br>The conscious lawns more brilliant verdure dress'd,</br>The warbling streams more musically glide,</br>Blithe by her side two snowy lambkins stray,</br>Bleating their inoffensive welcome meek;</br>The glowing flowers superior charms display,</br>And emulate her heaven-impurpled cheek.</br>Th' exulting groves distill'd ambrosial dew,</br>The sky more brightly smil'd, illum'd with lovelier blue.

Her nectar'd lips two living rubies seem'd,</br>Whence, melting slow on my delighted ear,</br>A bland, inchanting voice mellifluous stream'd,</br>Whose sound the languishments of death might chear!</br>Above yon sun I triumph, heavenly-born,</br>Nurs'd in the skies, and PITY is my name;</br>I mingle with th' enraptur'd Sons of morn,</br>My bosom glowing with congenial flame:</br>My Halleluiahs harmonize with theirs</br>When from their pealing harps they pour their noblest airs.

When aim'd at guilty man the brandish'd fire</br>Of the Almighty's threatening sword appears,</br>I deprecate the thunder of his ire,</br>And quench its lightning with my falling tears.</br>I on his sov'reign justice dare intrude:</br>With aspect amiably benign and mild</br>He views me kneeling, owns himself subdu'd</br>By the soft pleadings of his darling child;</br>And while my lute with glad Hosannas rings</br>Ev'n listens with delight to its seraphic strings!

Commission'd by my great propitious Sire,</br>Whose sun, faint emblem of Himself, on all</br>Impartial darts its life-diffusing fire;</br>Whose freshening showers without distinction fall;</br>The vesting blaze of majesty divine</br>Aside I threw, and left the realms above,</br>by meek persuasive words and deeds benign</br>To shew mankind the image of his love.</br>In HANWAY's favour'd form I dwelt inshrin'd,</br>And triumph'd uncontroul'd in his congenial mind.

High heaven's assiduous delegate below,</br>I taught his heart ev'n for the worm to feel,</br>To bleed at misery in a fallen foe,</br>And sooth his sufferings, if it could not heal.</br>Sweeter, far sweeter to th' ETERNAL's ear</br>Than hymns of angels is the generous sigh;</br>More pleasing far one sympathizing tear</br>Than all heaven's glories, to his sacred eye!</br>Her HANWAY's loss PHILANTHROPY shall mourn,</br>And strow, till time expires, her roses o'er his urn.

A kind asylum ever prompt to lend</br>Ere starving misery could his aid implore,</br>He sought the title of the poor man's friend,</br>(Divine ambition!)  and he sought no more.</br>No echoing trump to peal his praises forth,</br>No mausoleum, rear'd with matchless art,</br>His virtues need; the memory of his worth</br>Shall live forever in his Country's heart.</br>She ceas'd.  With soaring wing she sail'd away</br>To her own native clime, to brighter, happier day.

Instant with thrilling sound a trumpet blew,</br>And at my side a flaming car appears:</br>I mount it straight; it in a moment flew,</br>By two swift eagles drawn, above the spheres.</br>And now my senses drink the balmier ray</br>Of fairer suns in a more blissful clime,</br>Where groves ascend, with brighter fountains gay,</br>And meadows flourish in superior prime;</br>Where life's aspiring tree o'er amarant bow'rs</br>Its brilliant foliage waves, and blooms immortal flow'rs!

O'er the delicious landscape as I stray'd,</br>New vistas open, lovelier scenes arise;</br>Till the whole Paradise of God display'd</br>In boundless prospect all around me lies!</br>Sudden a mountain, like a gorgeous throne</br>Of costliest pearl and flaming rubies, towr'd;</br>Smooth round its basis, like a silver zone,</br>A river pure its liquid crystal pour'd:</br>Unseen the summit; its stupendous height</br>Was veil'd in blazing clouds, in ambient floods of light.

To celebrate th' unutterable things</br>I there beheld, o'erpowers a mortal tongue!</br>Some rapturous Seraph, lend thy hymning strings,</br>And teach the language by Archangels sung!</br>Not visions more sublime the Bard amaz'd</br>In the proud plains of CHEBAR lave;</br>Not the young Seer on holier mysteries gaz'd,</br>Where beauteous ULAI winds her amber wave;</br>Not He in PATMOS' isle, whose spirit soar'd</br>Upon seraphic wing, and inmost heaven explor'd!

Triumphant strains burst on my wondering ear,</br>As from soft dulcimer and deep-ton'd lyre;</br>Then myriads of angelic forms appear,</br>Celestial extasies my breast inspire.</br>Some strike the cymbal, some the mellower lute;</br>Others their golden clarions loudly blow;</br>And solemn from the silver-sounding flute,</br>Strong but more sweet, the torrent raptures flow;</br>While all, dissolv'd in hymns of burning zeal,</br>Around th' imperial mount in glittering order kneel.

But who is he, by two bright Cherubs led,</br>Clad in white robes, too glorious to behold?</br>A smiling Seraph places on his head</br>A coronet of palm adorn'd with gold.</br>'Tis HANWAY's self!  his aspect more benign</br>Than when on earth he silenc'd misery's cry!</br>Illumin'd are his eyes with joy divine,</br>He greets his radiant kindred of the sky.</br>His feet as in a burning furnace glow,</br>Grand o'er the sapphire road his starry vestments flow.

Waving their azure wings, th' immortal pow'rs</br>With kind complacence the new guest survey;</br>Around the crystal domes and emerald tow'rs</br>Fresh streams of splendour beautifully play.</br>And now heaven's organ breathes a loftier strain,</br>From angel harps new Halleluiahs rise;</br>While vocal warblings from each bower and plain</br>Sublimely swell the music of the skies!</br>The mystic song his lyre adoring learns,</br>On its responsive strings seraphic transport burns!

These words soft-streaming from th' empyreal hill,</br>Float on the wings of an ambrosial gale,</br>Hail, faithful follower of th' eternal will,</br>Thou votary of heaven-born Pity, hail.</br>Blest servant of th' ALL-HIGH, to thee 'tis given</br>To quaff delights that never, never cloy,</br>To mingle with th' inhabitants of heav'n,</br>And lose Eternity in boundless joy!</br>Among thy brother angels now 'tis thine</br>On thrones sublime as theirs with rival beams to shine!

How was that wealth which Folly's sons profane</br>Ennobled, hallow'd by thy liberal hand,</br>While with each feeling pious and humane</br>Thy zealous heart still gloried to expand!</br>Thine was th' exalted, angel-like employ,</br>With comfort's lenient balm to soften care,</br>To make the mourner's bosom throb with joy,</br>And hush the frantic groan of wild despair.</br>The wretch, long us'd his scanty food to steep</br>In sorrow, saw thy face, and quickly ceas'd to weep.

The silent language of the orphan's tears,</br>That spoke resistless to thy heart on earth,</br>In sacred union with thy spotless pray'rs,</br>Thy welcome wins from all of heavenly birth.</br>Thy rapt devotions fail'd not to ascend</br>In pure memorial to the realms divine,</br>And with the holy clouds of incense blend</br>Which seraphs burn before th' Almighty's shrine.</br>Wafted by Faith upon her towering wings,</br>Such charities as thine delight the KING of Kings.

Here ceas'd the voice.  I trembling then advance</br>And thus address him, sainted spirit bend</br>From heaven's cerulean arch thy frequent glance,</br>And hear what blessings round thy urn ascend!</br>Hear the deserted child, thy piteous eye</br>Watch'd with a father's care, a father's love,</br>Lisp thy dear name with many a duteous sigh,</br>And fondly call thee from the joys above.</br>See the sad penitent with awe profound</br>Bend o'er her patron's grave, and kiss the sacred ground.

Hear how she breathes her warm resolve to tread</br>In tempting ruin's flowery maze no more;</br>Hear how the aged who their daily bread</br>Owe to thy bounty, with the young deplore.</br>For, though imparadis'd with angel choirs,</br>Though the blest Kingdom, to the virtuous giv'n,</br>Shall still be thine when Nature's self expires,</br>Yet must it swell thy bliss, improve thy heav'n,</br>To know, thy tomb is hail'd with grief sincere,</br>Thy memory imbalm'd with many a grateful tear.

I said:  and straight a warriour angel came</br>From a surrounding cloud; his rich attire</br>Was living purple mix'd with lambent flame;</br>A sun, his shield; his falchion, solid fire.</br>Wide o'er him in triumphal grandeur spread,</br>A rainbow waves its roseate streamers high;</br>An adamantine helmet grac'd his head,</br>Stupendous glories lighten'd from his eye!</br>Though terror nodded in his crimson plume,</br>Yet mildness temper'd sweet his aspect's orient bloom.

Majestic o'er the star-bespangled way</br>He moves, and as with voice of thunder cries,</br>Mortal, profane no more the realms of day,</br>Those glorious seats, with thy unhallow'd eyes.</br>Hence to thy kindred element depart,</br>Thy native earth.  And must yon sordid sphere,</br>Sad I reply'd, still claim me?  but my heart</br>Shall dwell for ever, heaven-enamour'd, here.</br>Straight the bright phantom vanish'd from my sight,</br>Sleep with the vision fled, and left me veil'd in night.</br>
